CVE-2024-1056
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-29T15:30:40

2 posts

The FunnelKit Funnel Builder Pro plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the 'allow_iframe_tag_in_post' function which uses the 'wp_kses_allowed_html' filter to globally allow script and iframe tags in posts in all versions up to, and including, 3.4.5. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access and above, to inject arbitrary web script

AAKL at 2024-08-28T17:17:15.439Z ##

Wordfense has added 10 #WordPress plugin vulnerabilities to its database, some of them severe. These include:

CVE-2024-7418; CVE-2024-1056; CVE-2024-5987; CVE-2024-7857 (two of them); CVE-2024-7606; CVE-2024-7607; CVE-2024-3944; CVE-2024-7856; CVE-2022-2440

https://www.wordfence.com/threat-intel/vulnerabilities #cybersecurity #infosec

CVE-2024-7607
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-29T12:31:12

2 posts

The Front End Users plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to time-based SQL Injection via the ‘order’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.2.28 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to append additional SQL queri

CVE-2024-7856
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-29T12:31:11

2 posts

The MP3 Audio Player – Music Player, Podcast Player & Radio by Sonaar plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized arbitrary file deletion due to a missing capability check on the removeTempFiles() function and insufficient path validation on the 'file' parameter in all versions up to, and including, 5.7.0.1. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access an

EPSS: 0.78%

updated 2024-08-29T01:00:00.997000

36 posts

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T14:09:26.407Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
It's so hot off the press that the page isn't live yet. CVE-2024-7965 (8.8 high, disclosed 21 August 2024 by Google, and updated 26 August 2024 to note that it was an exploited zero-day fr fr) Google Chromium V8 Inappropriate Implementation Vulnerability was added to the KEV Catalog

cc: @ntkramer @hrbrmstr @neurovagrant

#CVE_2024_7965 #eitw #zeroday #vulnerability #activeexploitation #Google #Chrome #Chromium #cia #kev

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-26T23:37:49.579Z ##

Google updated their security advisory from 21 August 2024 noting that CVE-2024-7965 (high severity, Inappropriate implementation in V8. Reported by TheDog on 2024-07-30) was also an exploited zero-day:

Updated on 26 August 2024 to reflect the in the wild exploitation of CVE-2024-7965 which was reported after this release.
Google is aware that exploits for CVE-2024-7971 and CVE-2024-7965 exist in the wild.

h/t: @neurovagrant . See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Google tags a tenth Chrome zero-day as exploited this year

#CVE_2024_7965 #eitw #zeroday #vulnerability #activeexploitation #Google #Chrome #Chromium

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-27T14:16:15.849Z ##

Update: CISA has added CVE-2024-7971 to its known exploited catalog.

Moreover, Google Chrome has added CVE-2024-7965 as a known exploited vulnerability today.

A few advisories from other vendors addressing CVE-2024-7971 is mentioned below:

Microsoft Edge: Upgrade to Microsoft Edge version 128.0.2739.42 or later.

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-7971

openSuSE: https://lists.opensuse.org/archives/list/security-announce@lists.opensuse.org/thread/G5G3DFUIZH3E3T5UIPSI3LSGCI5KE3NF/

https://www.suse.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-7971.html

FreeBSD : https://vuxml.freebsd.org/freebsd/b339992e-6059-11ef-8a0f-a8a1599412c6.html

Debian: https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-7971

##

CVE-2024-43472
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.13%

updated 2024-08-28T19:13:21.393000

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T19:45:18.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-43472 (5.8 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
Okay if you were following along with my parent toot, the CVE got published. The impact is browser sandbox escape, and there's some conflicting information in the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section about no effect on Integrity or Availability, which is contradicted in the CVSSv3.1 vector and in the next question.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would first have to log on to the system. An attacker could then run a specially crafted application that could exploit the vulnerability and take control of an affected system.

Additionally, an attacker could convince a local user to open a malicious file. The attacker would have to convince the user to click a link, typically by way of an enticement in an email or instant message, and then convince them to open the specially crafted file.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, Exploitation Less Likely.

#CVE_2024_43472 #Edge #Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T16:21:04.000Z ##

Microsoft security advisory: Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates
Normally I don't bother talking about Microsoft Edge since it just gets updated against Google Chrome-announced CVEs from earlier in the week. What's unique this time, is that the most recent Google Chrome update (see parent toot above) contains no security fixes.

This update contains the following Microsoft Edge-specific update: CVE-2024-43472

The vulnerability page doesn't exist, and MITRE hasn't updated it beyond "RESERVED". So we don't know what this is yet.

#CVE_2024_43472 #Microsoft #Edge #vulnerability #CVE

An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including crafted input as the argument of the affe

screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T16:26:45.398Z ##

Cisco security advisories:

  • Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller Unauthorized Policy Actions Vulnerability CVE-2024-20279 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco NX-OS Software Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20289 (4.4 medium)
  • Cisco NX-OS Software Bash Arbitrary Code Execution and Privilege Escalation Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20411 and CVE-2024-20413 (6.7 medium)
  • Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20478 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco NX-OS Software DHCPv6 Relay Agent Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20446 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco NX-OS Software Python Sandbox Escape Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20284, CVE-2024-20285, CVE-2024-20286 (5.3 medium)

At a glance, nothing significant sticks out. Some advisories have a combination of "migrate to a fixed version" and fixed releases.

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #CVE #Vulnerability

A vulnerability in the DHCPv6 relay agent of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper handling of specific fields in a DHCPv6 RELAY-REPLY message. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted DHCPv6 packet to any IPv6 address that is configured

Cisco security advisories:

  • Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller Unauthorized Policy Actions Vulnerability CVE-2024-20279 (4.3 medium)
  • Cisco NX-OS Software Command Injection Vulnerability CVE-2024-20289 (4.4 medium)
  • Cisco NX-OS Software Bash Arbitrary Code Execution and Privilege Escalation Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20411 and CVE-2024-20413 (6.7 medium)
  • Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20478 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco NX-OS Software DHCPv6 Relay Agent Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20446 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco NX-OS Software Python Sandbox Escape Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20284, CVE-2024-20285, CVE-2024-20286 (5.3 medium)

At a glance, nothing significant sticks out. Some advisories have a combination of "migrate to a fixed version" and fixed releases.

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #CVE #Vulnerability

CVE-2024-38856
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.27%

updated 2024-08-28T16:15:58.043000

21 posts

Incorrect Authorization vulnerability in Apache OFBiz. This issue affects Apache OFBiz: through 18.12.14. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.15, which fixes the issue. Unauthenticated endpoints could allow execution of screen rendering code of screens if some preconditions are met (such as when the screen definitions don't explicitly check user's permissions because they rely on

##
dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev@dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev at 2024-08-29T16:16:40.000Z ##

I Am The Very Modelfile Of A Modern Workflow General; The Impending ‘Reimagine’ Nightmare;

We return to the semi-regular AI-foucused Drop with a quick look at how to (quickly and easily!) make a custom Ollama model to make a small, useful tool.

Programming note: due to driving #4 to college Friday, there may not be a Drop. But, if the round trip is not too taxing, I’ll likley get one out int he late afternoon.

Type your email…

Subscribe

TL;DR

(This is an AI-generated summary of today’s Drop using Sonnet via Perplexity.)

  • A guide on creating a custom Ollama model using a Modelfile to generate concise names for CVE vulnerabilities, similar to CISA’s KEV catalog entries (https://github.com/ollama/ollama/blob/main/docs/modelfile.md)
  • Discussion of Google’s new Pixel 9 “Reimagine” feature, which allows users to manipulate photos using AI, raising concerns about the potential misuse of such technology (https://www.theverge.com/2024/8/21/24224084/google-pixel-9-reimagine-ai-photos)
  • Introduction to “The Inference,” a new editorial project by Danny Palmer published by Darktrace, exploring the impact of AI on cybersecurity and society (https://darktrace.com/the-inference)

I Am The Very Modelfile Of A Modern Workflow General

[🖼 dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev/wp-cont…]Photo by Pixabay on Pexels.com

Longtime readers know I’m #notAFan of the “Open AI tax”. TL;DR for new readers is that I believe it is yugely important to ensure everyone had access to LLM/GPT tooling. These tools/services are not going away anytime soon; and, not knowing how to work with them puts other folks at an needless advantage. Ollama does a great job helping to level the playing field.

Ollama supports adding layers on top of existing models via something called a Modelfile. It’s a plain text file that lets you add in some parameters, prompts, examples, etc. so you don’t have to shunt them along with each new incantation. The format for these is, essentially:

# commentINSTRUCTION arguments

Some key instructions include:

  • FROM: Identifies the base model (mandatory)
  • PARAMETER: Customizes model behavior through various settings
  • TEMPLATE: Defines the prompt template sent to the model
  • SYSTEM: Sets up system messages
  • ADAPTER: Integrates adapters for QLoRA
  • LICENSE: Specifies legal licenses
  • MESSAGE: Adds preset message histories

You can inspect the configuration of models you download and use pretty simply:

$ ollama show phi:latest --modelfile# Modelfile generated by "ollama show"# To build a new Modelfile based on this, replace FROM with:# FROM phi:latestFROM /path/to/.ollama/models/blobs/sha256-04778965089b91318ad61d0995b7e44fad4b9a9f4e049d7be90932bf8812e828TEMPLATE "{{ if .System }}System: {{ .System }}{{ end }}User: {{ .Prompt }}Assistant:"SYSTEM A chat between a curious user and an artificial intelligence assistant. The assistant gives helpful answers to the user's questions.PARAMETER stop User:PARAMETER stop Assistant:PARAMETER stop System:LICENSE """MIT License … """

(They work in a similar fashion to Dockerfiles.)

You can go here for a more in-depth explanation of the instructions and values. I’m just going to briefly show how to make one to solve a fun “problem”.

I talk quite a bit about CISA’s Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog (KEV), and one nice thing the Keepers of KEV do for us is create a short name for any vulnerability they add to the catalog. CVE entries only have a longer-length description associated with their identifier, like CVE-2024-38856’s Apache OFBiz contains an incorrect authorization vulnerability that could allow remote code execution via a Groovy payload in the context of the OFBiz user process by an unauthenticated attacker.. The KEV entry for that uses the concise name of Apache OFBiz Incorrect Authorization Vulnerability, making it much easier to reference (and has way more info than just a bare CVE identifier).

At $WORK, we got it into our noggins to be as kind as the KEV Keepers and associate a concise name with any CVEs we display (and for an upcoming product/API feature). There is no way we were going to lovingly hand-craft those for a few hundred thousand entries. And, I’m loathe to give any AI vendor money. So, we built a custom PHI model to do this for us! And, are sharing it with y’all right here (we’ll working on posting the CVE ids with concise to GitHub when we’re done cleaning them up).

After a few iterations, here’s the Modelfile we ended up with:

FROM phi:latestPARAMETER temperature 0.0PARAMETER stop "\n"PARAMETER num_predict 30PARAMETER top_p 0.95SYSTEM """You are an AI system specializing in generating concise short names for vulnerabilities described by CVEs. Your task is to convert verbose CVE descriptions into clear, descriptive titles that resemble entries in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. Stop generating output immediately after providing the short name.PROMPT Given a CVE description, create a short name similar to those used in CISA's KEV catalog. The short name should be concise, descriptive, and highlight the affected product or vulnerability type. Do not provide additional information or explanations. The response should be under 10 words and should end immediately after the short name.Examples:CVE description: A vulnerability in the TCP/IP stack of Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device.Short name: Cisco IOS XR TCP/IP Stack DoS VulnerabilityCVE description: Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2021-26855, CVE-2021-26857, CVE-2021-26858, CVE-2021-27065.Short name: Microsoft Exchange Server RCE VulnerabilityNow, create a short name for this CVE:"""

The temperature controls the “creativity” of the output, with 0.0 being fully deterministic. Even with that, we were getting some odd output behavior, so we added a “please stop generating” hint at when it outputs a newline, set the max number of output tokens to 30 (I may change that to 20), and asked it to only make high “next token” probability choices.

Rather than muck with special tokens, I went with a basic prompt-with-few-shot-examples approach.

To make our new model, we just:

$ ollama create cve-shortener -f ./Modelfile

Then just try it out:

$ ollama run cve-shortener 'Topline Opportunity Form (aka XLS Opp form) before 2015-02-15 does not properly restrict access to database-connection strings, which allows attackers to read the cleartext version of sensitive credential and e-mail address information via unspecified vectors.'Topline Opportunity Form (XLS Opp) Database Vulnerability

Like most LLM/GPT output in API contexts, you’ll need to add some guardrails for cleaning up results or retrying the prompt. (Yes, even with all the constraints in the Modelfile, this one still borks output every so often.)

On my aging Apple Silicon box, each call takes ~200-600ms, depending on the inputs and other system GPU load.

If you find yourself repeating prompts, this is a lightweight way to avoid doing so. And, if you have some similar, focused tasks that need doing, getting a hand from our AI overlords can help save quite a bit of time.

The Impending ‘Reimagine’ Nightmare

[🖼 dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev/wp-cont…]Photo by cottonbro studio on Pexels.com

Super quick section, since I believe Welch’s examples say everything vs. have me blather much.

Chris Welch, an editor over at The Verge, acquired one of Google’s new Pixel 9 devices and gave the new Reimagine feature a go and posted some results on Threads and The Verge. This, to me, is a pretty terrifying new capability.

We’re already awash in deepfakes, photorealistic child image exploitation, advanced phishing, and shady political campaigns making it almost impossible to tell truth from fiction. The last thing we needed was to commodify this tech so anyone who can afford a certain class of portable glowing rectangles can get in on the gambit.

Let’s hope the majority of uses are benign/silly.

The Inference

[🖼 dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev/wp-cont…]

Another quick section, as this content also speaks for itself pretty well.

Danny Palmer is an excellent writer on cybersecurity topics. He has a new editorial project that’s being published by cybersecurity vendor Darktrace (yeah, that’s “a thing” in my line of work).

The Inference explores the impact of AI on the world around us, starting within the security operations center and expanding to business and society writ large. Features on it analyze data, trends, and perspectives from experts inside and outside of Darktrace to educate and inspire readers about the role that AI plays in enabling innovation and how it can be applied safely and securely.

I link to it since the first few pieces:

  • AI and the biggest election year ever – are we ready?
  • The role of IT support engineering in the age of AI
  • In conversation with Professor Mike Woolridge
  • Malware-as-a-Service: what you need to know about this persistent cyber threat

were very well crafted, and I thought more than a few readers would want to get this into their RSS feeds.

(As usual, I get nothing for Dropping a link to this post, save for providing y’all with something I found interesting.)

FIN

Remember, you can follow and interact with the full text of The Daily Drop’s free posts on Mastodon via @dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev@dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev ☮️

https://dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev/2024/08/29/drop-523-2024-08-29-happy-thursdai/

CVE-2024-43788

updated 2024-08-27T19:50:41

Hi, Webpack developer team! ### Summary We discovered a DOM Clobbering vulnerability in Webpack’s `AutoPublicPathRuntimeModule`. The DOM Clobbering gadget in the module can lead to cross-site scripting (XSS) in web pages where scriptless attacker-controlled HTML elements (e.g., an `img` tag with an unsanitized `name` attribute) are present. We found the real-world exploitation of this gadget in

ethanjstark@hachyderm.io at 2024-08-28T13:06:06.000Z ##

“Webpack's AutoPublicPathRuntimeModule has a DOM Clobbering Gadget that leads to XSS”

https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-43788

CVE-2024-22262
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-27T18:36:47

2 posts

Applications that use UriComponentsBuilder to parse an externally provided URL (e.g. through a query parameter) AND perform validation checks on the host of the parsed URL may be vulnerable to a open redirect https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/601.html  attack or to a SSRF attack if the URL is used after passing validation checks. This is the same as CVE-2024-22259 https://spring.io/securit

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE

  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.000Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##

CVE-2024-39717
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.26%

updated 2024-08-27T18:31:36

48 posts

The Versa Director GUI provides an option to customize the look and feel of the user interface. This option is only available for a user logged with Provider-Data-Center-Admin or Provider-Data-Center-System-Admin. (Tenant level users do not have this privilege). The “Change Favicon” (Favorite Icon) option can be mis-used to upload a malicious file ending with .png extension to masquerade as image

screaminggoat at 2024-08-27T18:00:11.255Z ##

CISA: Versa Networks Releases Advisory for a Vulnerability in Versa Director, CVE-2024-39717
Reference: CVE-2024-39717 (NVD CVSSv3: 7.2 high, disclosed 23 August 2024 by CISA who added it to the KEV Catalog) Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability.

CISA highlights the security advisory and Lumen article talking about Volt Typhoon's zero-day exploitation of CVE-2024-39717 since June 2024 against U.S. and non-U.S. victims in the IT, ISP and MSP sectors. Volt Typhoon, aka Bronze Silhouette or Vanguard Panda, is a Chinese state-sponsored APT. IOC for the new VersaMem web shell are available on GitHub

#CVE_2024_39717 #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #kev #cisa #versa #versadirector #cve #china #cyberespionage #VoltTyphoon #apt #IOC #threatintel

##
threatcodex at 2024-08-27T15:18:36.643Z ##

Taking the Crossroads: The Versa Director Zero-Day Exploitation
#CVE_2024_39717 #VoltTyphoon
https://blog.lumen.com/taking-the-crossroads-the-versa-director-zero-day-exploitation/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-27T14:29:52.961Z ##

@briankrebs Black Lotus Labs article is live: https://blog.lumen.com/taking-the-crossroads-the-versa-director-zero-day-exploitation/

IOC are included: https://github.com/blacklotuslabs/IOCs/blob/main/VersaMem_IOCs.txt

#volttyphoon #zeroday #CVE_2024_39717 #eitw #KEV #vulnerability #china #cerespionage

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-27T14:03:08.136Z ##

Lumen Black Lotus Labs: Taking the Crossroads: The Versa Director Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above for additional information about CVE-2024-39717, the Versa Director Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability.

This vulnerability is found in Versa software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) applications and affects all Versa Director versions prior to 22.1.4. Versa Director servers manage the network configurations for clients running the SD-WAN software and are often used by internet service providers (ISPs) and managed service providers (MSPs).

Black Lotus Labs identified a unique, custom-tailored web shell (dubbed VersaMem) whose primary purpose is to intercept and harvest credentials which would enable access into downstream customers’ networks as an authenticated user. VersaMem enabled the threat actors to load additional Java code to run exclusively in-memory. Their analysis identified actor-controlled small-office/home-office (SOHO) devices exploiting this zero-day vulnerability at four U.S. victims and one non-U.S. victim in the Internet service provider (ISP), managed service provider (MSP) and information technology (IT) sectors as early as June 12, 2024.

They assess the exploitation of this vulnerability is limited to the Chinese APT Volt Typhoon and is likely ongoing against unpatched Versa Director systems.

IOC provided.* Edit 2: IOC file for VersaMem is now filled out

cc: @campuscodi

#threatintel #voltTyphoon #china #cyberespionage #vulnerability #zeroday #CVE_2024_39717 #eitw #kev #activeexploitation #versamem #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-26T19:25:18.025Z ##

Security Week: Chinese APT Volt Typhoon Caught Exploiting Versa Networks SD-WAN Zero-Day
See parent toots for related information. Security Week is citing the Black Lotus Labs team at Lumen Technologies, saying that the Chinese state-sponsored APT Volt Typhoon exploited CVE-2024-39717 as a zero-day. At this time, there is no related post from Black Lotus Labs, and I'll post an update when it does.

cc: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_39717 #vulnerability #zeroday #china #cyberespionage #APT #VoltTyphoon #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-26T14:44:07.576Z ##

Versa security advisory: Versa Security Bulletin: Update on CVE-2024-39717 – Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability
See parent toot above for CISA adding CVE-2024-39717 to the KEV Catalog. Here is some notable information:

  • CVE-2024-39717 affects all Versa SD-WAN customers using Versa Director, that have not implemented the system hardening and firewall guidelines.
  • The impacted users were Managed Service Providers
  • "This vulnerability has been exploited in at least one known instance by an Advanced Persistent Threat actor."
  • The threat actors had Provider-Data-Center-Admin or Provider-Data-Center-System-Admin privileges, in order to upload malicious files.
  • Impacted customers failed to implement system hardening and firewall guidelines, with an internet-exposed management port.

Versa released a patch to address CVE-2024-39717, and provided Firewall Guidelines and System Hardening guidance.

Note: A CISA joint cybersecurity advisory from 2022 states that “threat actors can use a vulnerable MSP as an initial access vector to multiple victim networks, with globally cascading effects.” This security advisory was published today while all of the other URLs in NVD/Mitre are behind a loginwall.

cc: @ntkramer

#CVE_2024_39717 #vulnerability #CVE #Versa #cyberespionage #apt #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-24T01:40:21.175Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog for Versa Networks Director
CVE-2024-39717 (6.6 medium) Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability
Yeah I wasn't expecting a Friday night KEV cc: @hrbrmstr @ntkramer

CISA: Versa Networks Releases Advisory for a Vulnerability in Versa Director, CVE-2024-39717
Reference: CVE-2024-39717 (NVD CVSSv3: 7.2 high, disclosed 23 August 2024 by CISA who added it to the KEV Catalog) Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability.

CISA highlights the security advisory and Lumen article talking about Volt Typhoon's zero-day exploitation of CVE-2024-39717 since June 2024 against U.S. and non-U.S. victims in the IT, ISP and MSP sectors. Volt Typhoon, aka Bronze Silhouette or Vanguard Panda, is a Chinese state-sponsored APT. IOC for the new VersaMem web shell are available on GitHub

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-27T14:03:08.000Z ##

Lumen Black Lotus Labs: Taking the Crossroads: The Versa Director Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above for additional information about CVE-2024-39717, the Versa Director Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability.

This vulnerability is found in Versa software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) applications and affects all Versa Director versions prior to 22.1.4. Versa Director servers manage the network configurations for clients running the SD-WAN software and are often used by internet service providers (ISPs) and managed service providers (MSPs).

Black Lotus Labs identified a unique, custom-tailored web shell (dubbed VersaMem) whose primary purpose is to intercept and harvest credentials which would enable access into downstream customers’ networks as an authenticated user. VersaMem enabled the threat actors to load additional Java code to run exclusively in-memory. Their analysis identified actor-controlled small-office/home-office (SOHO) devices exploiting this zero-day vulnerability at four U.S. victims and one non-U.S. victim in the Internet service provider (ISP), managed service provider (MSP) and information technology (IT) sectors as early as June 12, 2024.

They assess the exploitation of this vulnerability is limited to the Chinese APT Volt Typhoon and is likely ongoing against unpatched Versa Director systems.

IOC provided.* Edit 2: IOC file for VersaMem is now filled out

cc: @campuscodi

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-26T14:44:07.000Z ##

Versa security advisory: Versa Security Bulletin: Update on CVE-2024-39717 – Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability
See parent toot above for CISA adding CVE-2024-39717 to the KEV Catalog. Here is some notable information:

  • CVE-2024-39717 affects all Versa SD-WAN customers using Versa Director, that have not implemented the system hardening and firewall guidelines.
  • The impacted users were Managed Service Providers
  • "This vulnerability has been exploited in at least one known instance by an Advanced Persistent Threat actor."
  • The threat actors had Provider-Data-Center-Admin or Provider-Data-Center-System-Admin privileges, in order to upload malicious files.
  • Impacted customers failed to implement system hardening and firewall guidelines, with an internet-exposed management port.

Versa released a patch to address CVE-2024-39717, and provided Firewall Guidelines and System Hardening guidance.

Note: A CISA joint cybersecurity advisory from 2022 states that “threat actors can use a vulnerable MSP as an initial access vector to multiple victim networks, with globally cascading effects.” This security advisory was published today while all of the other URLs in NVD/Mitre are behind a loginwall.

Lumen Black Lotus Labs: Taking the Crossroads: The Versa Director Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above for additional information about CVE-2024-39717, the Versa Director Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability.

This vulnerability is found in Versa software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) applications and affects all Versa Director versions prior to 22.1.4. Versa Director servers manage the network configurations for clients running the SD-WAN software and are often used by internet service providers (ISPs) and managed service providers (MSPs).

Black Lotus Labs identified a unique, custom-tailored web shell (dubbed VersaMem) whose primary purpose is to intercept and harvest credentials which would enable access into downstream customers’ networks as an authenticated user. VersaMem enabled the threat actors to load additional Java code to run exclusively in-memory. Their analysis identified actor-controlled small-office/home-office (SOHO) devices exploiting this zero-day vulnerability at four U.S. victims and one non-U.S. victim in the Internet service provider (ISP), managed service provider (MSP) and information technology (IT) sectors as early as June 12, 2024.

They assess the exploitation of this vulnerability is limited to the Chinese APT Volt Typhoon and is likely ongoing against unpatched Versa Director systems.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-26T14:44:07.576Z ##

Versa security advisory: Versa Security Bulletin: Update on CVE-2024-39717 – Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability
See parent toot above for CISA adding CVE-2024-39717 to the KEV Catalog. Here is some notable information:

  • CVE-2024-39717 affects all Versa SD-WAN customers using Versa Director, that have not implemented the system hardening and firewall guidelines.
  • The impacted users were Managed Service Providers
  • "This vulnerability has been exploited in at least one known instance by an Advanced Persistent Threat actor."
  • The threat actors had Provider-Data-Center-Admin or Provider-Data-Center-System-Admin privileges, in order to upload malicious files.
  • Impacted customers failed to implement system hardening and firewall guidelines, with an internet-exposed management port.

Versa released a patch to address CVE-2024-39717, and provided Firewall Guidelines and System Hardening guidance.

Note: A CISA joint cybersecurity advisory from 2022 states that “threat actors can use a vulnerable MSP as an initial access vector to multiple victim networks, with globally cascading effects.” This security advisory was published today while all of the other URLs in NVD/Mitre are behind a loginwall.

cc: @ntkramer

#CVE_2024_39717 #vulnerability #CVE #Versa #cyberespionage #apt #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #eitw #activeexploitation

Lumen Black Lotus Labs: Taking the Crossroads: The Versa Director Zero-Day Exploitation
See parent toots above for additional information about CVE-2024-39717, the Versa Director Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability.

This vulnerability is found in Versa software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) applications and affects all Versa Director versions prior to 22.1.4. Versa Director servers manage the network configurations for clients running the SD-WAN software and are often used by internet service providers (ISPs) and managed service providers (MSPs).

Black Lotus Labs identified a unique, custom-tailored web shell (dubbed VersaMem) whose primary purpose is to intercept and harvest credentials which would enable access into downstream customers’ networks as an authenticated user. VersaMem enabled the threat actors to load additional Java code to run exclusively in-memory. Their analysis identified actor-controlled small-office/home-office (SOHO) devices exploiting this zero-day vulnerability at four U.S. victims and one non-U.S. victim in the Internet service provider (ISP), managed service provider (MSP) and information technology (IT) sectors as early as June 12, 2024.

They assess the exploitation of this vulnerability is limited to the Chinese APT Volt Typhoon and is likely ongoing against unpatched Versa Director systems.

See parent toot above for CISA adding CVE-2024-39717 to the KEV Catalog. Here is some notable information:

  • The impacted users were Managed Service Providers
  • "This vulnerability has been exploited in at least one known instance by an Advanced Persistent Threat actor."
  • The threat actors had Provider-Data-Center-Admin or Provider-Data-Center-System-Admin privileges, in order to upload malicious files.
  • Impacted customers failed to implement system hardening and firewall guidelines, with an internet-exposed management port.

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-08-29T12:15:01.000Z ##

☣️ Hackers infect ISPs with malware that steals customers’ credentials
— Ars Technica

｢ CVE-2024-39717, as the zero-day is tracked, is an unsanitized file upload vulnerability that allows for the injection of malicious Java files that run on the Versa systems with elevated privileges. Versa patched the vulnerability Monday after Lumen privately reported it earlier. All versions of Versa Director prior to 22.1.4 are affected ｣

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/08/hackers-infect-isps-with-malware-that-steals-customers-credentials/

#isp #hacking #malware #cybersecurity

##

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-08-24T00:00:54.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-39717
Vendor: Versa
Product: Director
Date Added: 2024-08-23
Vulnerability: Versa Director Dangerous File Type Upload Vulnerability
Notes: Customers may download the update from the vendor at following link (note, a customer account is required): https://support.versa-networks.com/support/solutions/articles/23000026724-versa-director-ha-port-exploit-discovery-remediation
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-39717

##
jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-08-29T12:15:01.000Z ##

☣️ Hackers infect ISPs with malware that steals customers’ credentials
— Ars Technica

｢ CVE-2024-39717, as the zero-day is tracked, is an unsanitized file upload vulnerability that allows for the injection of malicious Java files that run on the Versa systems with elevated privileges. Versa patched the vulnerability Monday after Lumen privately reported it earlier. All versions of Versa Director prior to 22.1.4 are affected ｣

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/08/hackers-infect-isps-with-malware-that-steals-customers-credentials/

#isp #hacking #malware #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-6632
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-27T15:33:02

2 posts

A vulnerability exists in FileCatalyst Workflow whereby a field accessible to the super admin can be used to perform an SQL injection attack which can lead to a loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T18:59:02.869Z ##

Fortra security advisories:

  • GoAnywhere MFT (from 14 August 2024): Authentication bypass in GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.6.0 CVE-2024-25157 (6.5 medium)
  • FileCatalyst (from 27 August 2024):
    • Insecure Default in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) (9.8 critical) default credentials are published in a vendor knowledgebase article
    • SQL Injection in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) CVE-2024-6632 (7.2 high)

No mention of exploitation. But shame on FileCatalyst for having hardcoded credentials. See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Fortra fixes critical FileCatalyst Workflow hardcoded password issue

#fortra #filecatalyst #goanywhere #cve #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-28T18:59:02.000Z ##

  • GoAnywhere MFT (from 14 August 2024): Authentication bypass in GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.6.0 CVE-2024-25157 (6.5 medium)
  • FileCatalyst (from 27 August 2024):
    • Insecure Default in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) (9.8 critical) default credentials are published in a vendor knowledgebase article
    • SQL Injection in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) CVE-2024-6632 (7.2 high)

No mention of exploitation. But shame on FileCatalyst for having hardcoded credentials. See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Fortra fixes critical FileCatalyst Workflow hardcoded password issue

CVE-2024-6633
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-27T15:33:02

7 posts

The default credentials for the setup HSQL database (HSQLDB) for FileCatalyst Workflow are published in a vendor knowledgebase article. Misuse of these credentials could lead to a compromise of confidentiality, integrity, or availability of the software. The HSQLDB is only included to facilitate installation, has been deprecated, and is not intended for production use per vendor guides. However,

CVE-2024-38207
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-27T15:33:01

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-24T01:45:03.542Z ##

I missed one from yesterday (didn't show up in my RSS feed, see parent toot above):
Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-38207 (6.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability.
"This attack requires a user to click a link in order for an attacker to initiate remote code execution of valid opcodes."
Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

##

CVE-2024-41879
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-26T12:47:20.187000

2 posts

Acrobat Reader versions 127.0.2651.105 and earlier are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.936Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_38208 #CVE_2024_38209 #CVE_2024_38210 #CVE_2024_43477 #CVE_2024_7971 #CVE_2024_38178 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #northkorea #cyberespionage

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

CVE-2024-43398
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-23T16:18:28.547000

1 posts

REXML is an XML toolkit for Ruby. The REXML gem before 3.3.6 has a DoS vulnerability when it parses an XML that has many deep elements that have same local name attributes. If you need to parse untrusted XMLs with tree parser API like REXML::Document.new, you may be impacted to this vulnerability. If you use other parser APIs such as stream parser API and SAX2 parser API, this vulnerability is not

CVE-2024-5466
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-23T15:30:41

4 posts

Zohocorp ManageEngine OpManager and Remote Monitoring and Management versions 128329 and below are vulnerable to the authenticated remote code execution in the deploy agent option.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T02:27:19.987Z ##

Zoho ManageEngine OpManager security advisory: Authenticated Remote Code Execution (RCE) Vulnerability - CVE-2024-5466
CVE-2024-5466 (score pending, high severity) A Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability could be exploited by users with 'Write' access to the 'Deploy Agent' action in the UI. This has been fixed now.

This vulnerability allows users with 'Write' access to execute custom arbitrary commands on target servers.
This issue has been fixed by introducing parameter validation checks to verify the parameters before initiating remote connection.

No mention of exploitation. The real issue is that Zoho doesn't put any fucking publication date so I don't know when this was published.

#Zoho #cve_2024_5466 #vulnerability #CVE #opmanager #manageengine

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-23T02:27:19.000Z ##

CVE-2024-5466 (score pending, high severity) A Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability could be exploited by users with 'Write' access to the 'Deploy Agent' action in the UI. This has been fixed now.

This vulnerability allows users with 'Write' access to execute custom arbitrary commands on target servers.
This issue has been fixed by introducing parameter validation checks to verify the parameters before initiating remote connection.

No mention of exploitation. The real issue is that Zoho doesn't put any fucking publication date so I don't know when this was published.

CVE-2024-40766(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-23T09:30:35

8 posts

An improper access control vulnerability has been identified in the SonicWall SonicOS management access, potentially leading to unauthorized resource access and in specific conditions, causing the firewall to crash. This issue affects SonicWall Firewall Gen 5 and Gen 6 devices, as well as Gen 7 devices running SonicOS 7.0.1-5035 and older versions.

jbhall56 at 2024-08-27T11:22:01.433Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-40766 (CVSS score: 9.3), has been described as an improper access control bug. https://thehackernews.com/2024/08/sonicwall-issues-critical-patch-for.html

CVE-2024-40766 (8.6 high severity) improper access control vulnerability in the SonicWall SonicOS management access, potentially leading to unauthorized resource access and in specific conditions, causing the firewall to crash (DoS).
Fixed versions released. No mention of exploitation.

#SonicWall #vulnerability #cve_2024_40766 #sonicos

##

CVE-2024-43477
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-23T03:31:07

4 posts

Improper access control in Decentralized Identity Services allows an unathenticated attacker to disable Verifiable ID's on another tenant.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.936Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_38208 #CVE_2024_38209 #CVE_2024_38210 #CVE_2024_43477 #CVE_2024_7971 #CVE_2024_38178 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #northkorea #cyberespionage

##

CVE-2024-38209
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-23T00:31:50

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.936Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

CVE-2024-38210
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-23T00:31:50

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.936Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.

(6.1 MEDIUM)

updated 2024-08-23T00:31:45

2 posts

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.936Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

##

CVE-2024-22243
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-22T18:59:24

2 posts

Applications that use UriComponentsBuilder to parse an externally provided URL (e.g. through a query parameter) AND perform validation checks on the host of the parsed URL may be vulnerable to a open redirect attack or to a SSRF attack if the URL is used after passing validation checks.

2 repos

https://github.com/SeanPesce/CVE-2024-22243

https://github.com/shellfeel/CVE-2024-22243-CVE-2024-22234

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.000Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##

CVE-2024-7971
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.16%

updated 2024-08-22T15:31:19

32 posts

Type confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 128.0.6613.84 allowed a remote attacker to exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-08-26T18:39:23.790Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
CISA adds the Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-7971 to the KEV Catalog. See parent toots above for more information.

#Google #kev #chrome #zeroday #vulerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_7971 #cisa

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.936Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_38208 #CVE_2024_38209 #CVE_2024_38210 #CVE_2024_43477 #CVE_2024_7971 #CVE_2024_38178 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #northkorea #cyberespionage

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T20:37:52.256Z ##

This update includes 38 security fixes. (20 externally reported). CVE-2024-7971 (high severity) Type confusion in V8
Reported by Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center (MSTIC), Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) on 2024-08-19

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-27T14:16:15.849Z ##

Update: CISA has added CVE-2024-7971 to its known exploited catalog.

Moreover, Google Chrome has added CVE-2024-7965 as a known exploited vulnerability today.

A few advisories from other vendors addressing CVE-2024-7971 is mentioned below:

Microsoft Edge: Upgrade to Microsoft Edge version 128.0.2739.42 or later.

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-7971

openSuSE: https://lists.opensuse.org/archives/list/security-announce@lists.opensuse.org/thread/G5G3DFUIZH3E3T5UIPSI3LSGCI5KE3NF/

https://www.suse.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-7971.html

FreeBSD : https://vuxml.freebsd.org/freebsd/b339992e-6059-11ef-8a0f-a8a1599412c6.html

Debian: https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2024-7971

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-26T23:37:49.579Z ##

Google updated their security advisory from 21 August 2024 noting that CVE-2024-7965 (high severity, Inappropriate implementation in V8. Reported by TheDog on 2024-07-30) was also an exploited zero-day:

Updated on 26 August 2024 to reflect the in the wild exploitation of CVE-2024-7965 which was reported after this release.
Google is aware that exploits for CVE-2024-7971 and CVE-2024-7965 exist in the wild.

h/t: @neurovagrant . See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Google tags a tenth Chrome zero-day as exploited this year

#CVE_2024_7965 #eitw #zeroday #vulnerability #activeexploitation #Google #Chrome #Chromium

##

CVE-2021-33044
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.23%

updated 2024-08-22T03:31:33

4 posts

The identity authentication bypass vulnerability found in some Dahua products during the login process. Attackers can bypass device identity authentication by constructing malicious data packets.

Nuclei template

5 repos

https://github.com/jorhelp/Ingram

https://github.com/bp2008/DahuaLoginBypass

https://github.com/Alonzozzz/alonzzzo

https://github.com/haingn/LoHongCam-CVE-2021-33044

https://github.com/dorkerdevil/CVE-2021-33044

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-08-21T15:01:41.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2021-33044
Vendor: Dahua
Product: IP Camera Firmware
Date Added: 2024-08-21
Vulnerability: Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
Notes: https://www.dahuasecurity.com/aboutUs/trustedCenter/details/582
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-33044

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T14:40:38.457Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Super hot off the press!!! NOTE: I'm so quick that CISA hasn't even started the blog post yet, generating a Page Not Found page. I have it on good authority that the following are added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

  • CVE-2021-33044 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-33045 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-0185 (8.4 high) Linux Kernel Heap-Based Buffer Overflow
  • CVE-2021-31196 (7.2 high) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

Edit: Until that link works above, or someone corrects me, heres's a link to CISA's KEV Catalog

#cisa #kev #vulnerability #CVE #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #CVE_2021_33044 #CVE_2021_33045 #CVE_2022_0185 #CVE_2021_31196

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Super hot off the press!!! NOTE: I'm so quick that CISA hasn't even started the blog post yet, generating a Page Not Found page. I have it on good authority that the following are added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

  • CVE-2021-33044 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-33045 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-0185 (8.4 high) Linux Kernel Heap-Based Buffer Overflow
  • CVE-2021-31196 (7.2 high) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

Edit: Until that link works above, or someone corrects me, heres's a link to CISA's KEV Catalog

(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-22T00:31:11

14 posts

The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data.

jbhall56 at 2024-08-24T13:03:04.476Z ##

The disclosure of CVE-2024-28987 means that, in two weeks, there have been two critical bugs and corresponding patches for SolarWinds' less-often-discussed IT help desk software. https://www.darkreading.com/remote-workforce/patch-now-second-solarwinds-critical-bug-in-web-help-desk

##
AAKL at 2024-08-23T15:24:32.914Z ##

##

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-22T16:56:49.608Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory: Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28987)
Here we go again, another SolarWinds Web Help Desk vulnerability. I promise you this one is different:
CVE-2024-28987 (9.1 critical) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data.

No mention of exploitation. Discovered by Zach Hanley, while not listed, is part of Horizon3. He indicated at the Bad Place that he will post a technical writeup next month. Stay tuned.

#SolarWinds #vulnerability #CVE_2024_28987 #cve #webhelpdesk

iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-08-22T16:54:30.000Z ##

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-28000
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-21T15:31:00

3 posts

Incorrect Privilege Assignment vulnerability in LiteSpeed Technologies LiteSpeed Cache litespeed-cache allows Privilege Escalation.This issue affects LiteSpeed Cache: from 1.9 through 6.3.0.1.

3 repos

https://github.com/Alucard0x1/CVE-2024-28000

https://github.com/arch1m3d/CVE-2024-28000

https://github.com/ebrasha/CVE-2024-28000

benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-08-22T09:40:02.000Z ##

Une faille critique dans LiteSpeed Cache expose des millions de sites WordPress https://www.it-connect.fr/faille-critique-litespeed-cache-expose-des-millions-de-sites-wordpress-cve-2024-28000/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Vulnérabilité #Wordpress #Web

##
ottoto2017@prattohome.com at 2024-08-22T05:08:27.000Z ##

「Litespeed キャッシュのバグにより、数百万の WordPress サイトが乗っ取り攻撃にさらされる 」： BLEEPINGCOMPUTER

「LiteSpeed Cache WordPress プラグインの重大な脆弱性により、攻撃者が不正な管理者アカウントを作成した後、数百万の Web サイトを乗っ取る可能性があります。

LiteSpeed Cache はオープンソースで最も人気のある WordPress サイト高速化プラグインで、500 万以上のアクティブなインストールがあり、WooCommerce、bbPress、ClassicPress、Yoast SEO をサポートしています。

認証されていない権限昇格の脆弱性 ( CVE-2024-28000 ) は、プラグインのユーザー シミュレーション機能で見つかりました。バージョン 6.3.0.1 までの LiteSpeed Cache の弱いハッシュ チェックが原因で発生します。 」

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/litespeed-cache-bug-exposes-millions-of-wordpress-sites-to-takeover-attacks/

#prattohome #BLEEPINGCOMPUTER

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-08-22T09:40:02.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-6800(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-20T21:30:42

11 posts

An XML signature wrapping vulnerability was present in GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) when utilizing SAML authentication with specific identity providers. This vulnerability allowed an attacker with direct network access to GitHub Enterprise Server to forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user with site administrator privileges. Exploitation of this vulnerability would allow

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-08-26T10:40:33.000Z ##

The SAML Exploit That Could Take Down GitHub: What You Need to Know About CVE-2024-6800

SingCERT warned of CVE-2024-6800 in GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES), a critical flaw that lets attackers gain unauthorized access and control.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:40:53.030Z ##

GitHub security advisories from 20 August 2024:

  • Enterprise Server 3.10.16
  • Enterprise Server 3.11.14
  • Enterprise Server 3.12.8
  • Enterprise Server 3.13.3

The big one is CVE-2024-6800 (9.5 critical):

On GitHub Enterprise Server instances that use SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication with specific IdPs utilizing publicly exposed signed federation metadata XML, an attacker could forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user account with site administrator privileges.

No mention of exploitation. h/t to Qualys: GitHub Patches Multiple Security Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-6800, CVE-2024-6337, & CVE-2024-7711)

#cve #vulnerability #github #PatchTuesday

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T15:40:53.000Z ##

GitHub security advisories from 20 August 2024:

  • Enterprise Server 3.10.16
  • Enterprise Server 3.11.14
  • Enterprise Server 3.12.8
  • Enterprise Server 3.13.3

The big one is CVE-2024-6800 (9.5 critical):

On GitHub Enterprise Server instances that use SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication with specific IdPs utilizing publicly exposed signed federation metadata XML, an attacker could forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user account with site administrator privileges.

No mention of exploitation. h/t to Qualys: GitHub Patches Multiple Security Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-6800, CVE-2024-6337, & CVE-2024-7711)

#cve #vulnerability #github #PatchTuesday

##

CVE-2024-7711(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-20T21:30:42

2 posts

An Incorrect Authorization vulnerability was identified in GitHub Enterprise Server, allowing an attacker to update the title, assignees, and labels of any issue inside a public repository. This was only exploitable inside a public repository. This vulnerability affected GitHub Enterprise Server versions before 3.14 and was fixed in versions 3.13.3, 3.12.8, and 3.11.14. Versions 3.10 of GitHub Ent

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:40:53.030Z ##

  • Enterprise Server 3.10.16
  • Enterprise Server 3.11.14
  • Enterprise Server 3.12.8
  • Enterprise Server 3.13.3

This was only exploitable via user access token and installation access token was not impacted. This vulnerability affected all versions of GitHub Enterprise Server prior to
