##

CVE-2024-38175
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-20T21:30:42

2 posts

An improper access control vulnerability in the Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra allows an authenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T18:55:08.905Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-38175
CVE-2024-38175 (9.6 critical) Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CWE-284: Improper Access Control)

An attacker with permissions to deploy User Defined Functions (UDF) in an Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra cluster can send specially crafted requests to the underlying host and extract credentials for managed identities of other clusters on the same host node. The compromised credentials enable the attacker to impersonate the victim's managed identity and retrieve information from other clusters hosted on the node which could be outside of the attacker's tenant.
The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#CVE_2024_38175 #Azure #ApacheCassandra #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T18:55:08.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-38175
CVE-2024-38175 (9.6 critical) Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CWE-284: Improper Access Control)

An attacker with permissions to deploy User Defined Functions (UDF) in an Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra cluster can send specially crafted requests to the underlying host and extract credentials for managed identities of other clusters on the same host node. The compromised credentials enable the attacker to impersonate the victim's managed identity and retrieve information from other clusters hosted on the node which could be outside of the attacker's tenant.
The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#CVE_2024_38175 #Azure #ApacheCassandra #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-43399
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-20T18:44:48

2 posts

### Summary Upon reviewing the MobSF source code, I identified a flaw in the Static Libraries analysis section. Specifically, during the extraction of .a extension files, the measure intended to prevent Zip Slip attacks is improperly implemented. Since the implemented measure can be bypassed, the vulnerability allows an attacker to extract files to any desired location within the server running M

screaminggoat at 2024-08-27T11:35:00.126Z ##

Centre for Cybersecurity Belgium (CCB): Warning: Critical Vulnerability in Mobile Security Framework can Lead to Remote Code Execution, Patch Immediately!
Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is a pen-testing, malware analysis and security assessment framework capable of performing static and dynamic analysis. CCB warns that a proof of concept exists for CVE-2024-43399 (9.8 critical, disclosed 19 August 2024) a faulty implementation in preventing Zip Slip attacks allows for arbitrary file overwrite and resulting in remote code execution.

When the application scans a malicious file with the “.a” extension, it allows files to be extracted to any location on the server were the application is running. This can overwrite any existing file on the server and subsequently lead to Remote Code Execution.

#CVE_2024_43399 #MobSF #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept #poc

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-27T11:35:00.000Z ##

Centre for Cybersecurity Belgium (CCB): Warning: Critical Vulnerability in Mobile Security Framework can Lead to Remote Code Execution, Patch Immediately!
Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is a pen-testing, malware analysis and security assessment framework capable of performing static and dynamic analysis. CCB warns that a proof of concept exists for CVE-2024-43399 (9.8 critical, disclosed 19 August 2024) a faulty implementation in preventing Zip Slip attacks allows for arbitrary file overwrite and resulting in remote code execution.

When the application scans a malicious file with the “.a” extension, it allows files to be extracted to any location on the server were the application is running. This can overwrite any existing file on the server and subsequently lead to Remote Code Execution.

#CVE_2024_43399 #MobSF #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept #poc

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-20T18:32:23

2 posts

Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities affecting Vonets industrial wifi bridge relays and wifi bridge repeaters, software versions 3.3.23.6.9 and prior, enable an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.374Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

CVE-2024-23897
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.08%

updated 2024-08-20T18:00:43

9 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enable

Nuclei template

threatcodex at 2024-08-22T14:06:03.506Z ##

The Hidden Door: How CVE-2024-23897 Enabled Ransomware Attack on Indian Banks
#CVE_2024_23897
https://blogs.juniper.net/en-us/threat-research/cve-2024-23897-enabled-ransomware-attack-on-indian-banks

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.260Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T21:47:14.204Z ##

@jerry @kuoirad Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.
  • It's a path traversal vulnerability! a favorite of @reverseics

#CVE_2024_23897 #Jenkins #CISA #KEV #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation

Vendor: Jenkins
Product: Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI)
Date Added: 2024-08-19
Vulnerability: Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability
Notes: https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-01-24/#SECURITY-3314
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-23897

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CVE-2024-23897 (9.8 critical, disclosed 24 January 2024 by Jenkins, has Proof of Concept) Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability added to KEV Catalog.

#CISA #Jenkins #CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.000Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T21:47:14.000Z ##

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.
  • It's a path traversal vulnerability! a favorite of @reverseics

##

CVE-2024-21689
(7.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-20T12:30:27

3 posts

This High severity RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability CVE-2024-21689  was introduced in versions 9.1.0, 9.2.0, 9.3.0, 9.4.0, 9.5.0, and 9.6.0 of Bamboo Data Center and Server. This RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability, with a CVSS Score of 7.6, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code which has high impact to confidentiality, high impact to integrity, high impact to

1 repos

https://github.com/salvadornakamura/CVE-2024-21689

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-21T10:07:19.446Z ##

CVE-2024-21689 : Potential RCE vulnerability in Bamboo Data Center and Server.

Advisory:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-25858

Update Download Link and Release Notes:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bambooreleases/bamboo-release-notes-1189793869.html

https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download-archives

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.000Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##

CVE-2024-25157
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-19T21:35:08

2 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.6.0 allows Admin Users with access to the Agent Console to circumvent some permission checks when attempting to visit other pages. This could lead to unauthorized information disclosure or modification.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T18:59:02.869Z ##

Fortra security advisories:

  • GoAnywhere MFT (from 14 August 2024): Authentication bypass in GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.6.0 CVE-2024-25157 (6.5 medium)
  • FileCatalyst (from 27 August 2024):
    • Insecure Default in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) (9.8 critical) default credentials are published in a vendor knowledgebase article
    • SQL Injection in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) CVE-2024-6632 (7.2 high)

No mention of exploitation. But shame on FileCatalyst for having hardcoded credentials. See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Fortra fixes critical FileCatalyst Workflow hardcoded password issue

#fortra #filecatalyst #goanywhere #cve #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-41164
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-19T18:39:06.157000

1 posts

When TCP profile with Multipath TCP enabled (MPTCP) is configured on a Virtual Server, undisclosed traffic along with conditions beyond the attackers control can cause TMM to terminate. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T13:23:49.000Z ##

F5 Security advisories. No mention of exploitation:

  • K000140111: BIG-IP Next Central Manager vulnerability CVE-2024-39809
    • CVE-2024-39809 (CVSSv4 8.9 high) BIG-IP Next Central Manager user session refresh token does not expire.
  • K000140108: NGINX Plus MQTT vulnerability CVE-2024-39792
    • CVE-2024-39792 (CVSSv4 8.7 high) When NGINX Plus is configured to use the MQTT filter module, undisclosed requests can cause an increase in memory resource utilization.
  • K000138477: BIG-IP MPTCP vulnerability CVE-2024-41164
    • CVE-2024-41164 (CVSSv4 8.2 high) When a TCP profile with Multipath TCP enabled (MPTCP) is configured on a virtual server, undisclosed traffic along with conditions beyond the attacker's control can cause the Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to terminate.

#F5 #BIGIP #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-39792
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-19T16:20:28.967000

1 posts

When the NGINX Plus is configured to use the MQTT pre-read module, undisclosed requests can cause an increase in memory resource utilization.  Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated.

  • K000138477: BIG-IP MPTCP vulnerability CVE-2024-41164
    • CVE-2024-41164 (CVSSv4 8.2 high) When a TCP profile with Multipath TCP enabled (MPTCP) is configured on a virtual server, undisclosed traffic along with conditions beyond the attacker's control can cause the Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to terminate.

updated 2024-08-19T16:19:52.530000

1 posts

The Central Manager user session refresh token does not expire when a user logs out.  Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated

##

CVE-2024-6500
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-08-17T03:30:31

2 posts

The InPost for WooCommerce plugin and InPost PL plugin for WordPress are vulnerable to unauthorized access and deletion of data due to a missing capability check on the 'parse_request' function in all versions up to, and including, 1.4.0 (for InPost for WooCommerce) as well as 1.4.4 (for InPost PL). This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to read and delete arbitrary files on Windows

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.374Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

#CVE #vulnerability

CVE-2024-38063
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.12%

updated 2024-08-16T20:54:12.043000

48 posts

Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T17:35:53.945Z ##

SonicWall: Understanding CVE-2024-38063: How SonicWall Prevents Exploitation
SonicWall also performed patch diffing for CVE-2024-38063, and reached a similar conclusion to farmpoet (see parent toot above): "the patch was added to the Ipv6pProcessOptions function."

The additional, conditional logic in the updated version introduces checks before executing IppSendErrorList. The vulnerability takes advantage of an out-of-bound write (OOB) by sending malformed Ipv6 packets. It forces packets to be written to an error list called IppSendErrorList to obtain the correct conditions. The new checks only add packets to the list after the data is validated. Otherwise, it only sends an error without adding the packets to the list memory structure. The patch prevents unintended behavior or exploitation by ensuring that the functions IppSendError or IppSendErrorList are only called under appropriate conditions, reducing the risk of incorrect or malicious data being processed. This indicates that the vulnerable code likely still exists but is more complicated or potentially impossible to leverage.

cc: @wdormann @mttaggart @GossiTheDog in case anyone is still interested in CVE-2024-38063 analysis.

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket #rca

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:25:43.474Z ##

farmpoet has perhaps the best technical analysis (in a threaded conversation at the Bad Place ) of CVE-2024-38063 (9.8 critical) Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.
farmpoet notes that tcpip.sys kernel driver got an update during Patch Tuesday. After performing binary diffing, they narrowed it down to IppSendErrorList() and two possible code paths: Ipv6pValidateNetBuffer and Ipv6pReceiveDestinationOptions

Ipv6 doubled the header size compared to ipv4 so optional data needs to be provided in extension headers to avoid further bloat. A quick read at RFC 8200 gives us a list of possible extension headers.

farmpoet notes that "ipv6 has a feature which allows the sender to request the packet to be discarded and a notification to be sent back if the destination doesn't know how to handle a specific option."

the function receives a _NET_BUFFER_LIST.
The first field of that struct is a pointer to the next _NET_BUFFER it contains.
So IppSendErrorList just iterates through that single linked list until all packets in that _NET_BUFFER_LIST have been processed.

"At this point I dare to speculate the vulnerability may possibly be triggered by specially crafting packets which will cause an incorrect parsing by IppSendError... But what we've seen so far illustrates a very important point. That the vulnerability can't be triggered with a single packet. In fact, you'll have to flood the destination with packets just to reach the vulnerable path."

Read the whole thread with the technical jargon if you can't understand my summary. His take is that 9.8 severity is overblown because "at best we're talking about a remote denial of service and full RCE is intractable in this case."

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-19T02:48:13.469Z ##

Let's do a quick PoC check-in for #CVE_2024_38063, the IPv6 takeover bug in Windows, shall we?

This cute lil friend isn't even source code. Just an executable, which I will be taking apart tonight.

This Python repo, unless I'm misreading it, is utter BS that just does a dramatic reenactment of an exploit.

And this empty repo comes from one of the most vapory GH profiles I've seen in some time.

I'm sure I missed one, and I'm sure y'all will find it. But right now, seems like this thing is still theoretical. Of course patch, but do not panic.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-17T02:13:42.989Z ##

Robel Campbell of Blackpoint Cyber does it again: Regarding CVE-2024-38063 IPV6 RCE in Windows...
I saw this mentioned earlier on Mastodon but didn't get to boost it. Robel was able to create a PoC that causes a crash. His RCA on CVE-2024-38063:

The bug check in this case isn't too detailed, but essentially the underflow creates a large value used in a loop which eventually write data out of bounds and causes a crash.
I imagine this can be weaponized using heap massaging techniques and corrupting adjacent objects in the heap.

h/t: @decio

#CVE_2024_38063 #vulnerability #microsoft #ipv6 #cve

##

SonicWall also performed patch diffing for CVE-2024-38063, and reached a similar conclusion to farmpoet (see parent toot above): "the patch was added to the Ipv6pProcessOptions function."

The vulnerability takes advantage of an out-of-bound write (OOB) by sending malformed Ipv6 packets. It forces packets to be written to an error list called IppSendErrorList to obtain the correct conditions. The new checks only add packets to the list after the data is validated. Otherwise, it only sends an error without adding the packets to the list memory structure. The patch prevents unintended behavior or exploitation by ensuring that the functions IppSendError or IppSendErrorList are only called under appropriate conditions, reducing the risk of incorrect or malicious data being processed. This indicates that the vulnerable code likely still exists but is more complicated or potentially impossible to leverage.

##
axels@mastodon.social at 2024-08-21T16:58:10.000Z ##

PSA: Bad bug in #Windows update! Turn off IPv6 and update #CVE202438063

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

This is a zero click vulnerability, meaning you are vulnerable and don't need to click on anything to get exploited.

If you run Windows and have #IPv6, please turn it off. You need these updates to address the bug:

https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571

#CyberSecurity

##
sans_isc at 2024-08-20T14:11:35.202Z ##

Where are we with CVE-2024-38063: Microsoft IPv6 Vulnerability #ipv6 #cve202438063 https://isc.sans.edu/diary/31186

##
axels@mastodon.social at 2024-08-21T16:58:10.000Z ##

PSA: Bad bug in #Windows update! Turn off IPv6 and update #CVE202438063

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

This is a zero click vulnerability, meaning you are vulnerable and don't need to click on anything to get exploited.

If you run Windows and have #IPv6, please turn it off. You need these updates to address the bug:

https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571

Technical deep-dive
👇
https://infosec.exchange/@malwaretech/113032726284286625

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_38063 #PoC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T17:35:53.000Z ##

SonicWall: Understanding CVE-2024-38063: How SonicWall Prevents Exploitation
SonicWall also performed patch diffing for CVE-2024-38063, and reached a similar conclusion to farmpoet (see parent toot above): "the patch was added to the Ipv6pProcessOptions function."

The additional, conditional logic in the updated version introduces checks before executing IppSendErrorList. The vulnerability takes advantage of an out-of-bound write (OOB) by sending malformed Ipv6 packets. It forces packets to be written to an error list called IppSendErrorList to obtain the correct conditions. The new checks only add packets to the list after the data is validated. Otherwise, it only sends an error without adding the packets to the list memory structure. The patch prevents unintended behavior or exploitation by ensuring that the functions IppSendError or IppSendErrorList are only called under appropriate conditions, reducing the risk of incorrect or malicious data being processed. This indicates that the vulnerable code likely still exists but is more complicated or potentially impossible to leverage.

cc: @wdormann @mttaggart @GossiTheDog in case anyone is still interested in CVE-2024-38063 analysis.

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket #rca

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T15:25:43.000Z ##

farmpoet has perhaps the best technical analysis (in a threaded conversation at the Bad Place ) of CVE-2024-38063 (9.8 critical) Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.
farmpoet notes that tcpip.sys kernel driver got an update during Patch Tuesday. After performing binary diffing, they narrowed it down to IppSendErrorList() and two possible code paths: Ipv6pValidateNetBuffer and Ipv6pReceiveDestinationOptions

Ipv6 doubled the header size compared to ipv4 so optional data needs to be provided in extension headers to avoid further bloat. A quick read at RFC 8200 gives us a list of possible extension headers.

farmpoet notes that "ipv6 has a feature which allows the sender to request the packet to be discarded and a notification to be sent back if the destination doesn't know how to handle a specific option."

the function receives a _NET_BUFFER_LIST.
The first field of that struct is a pointer to the next _NET_BUFFER it contains.
So IppSendErrorList just iterates through that single linked list until all packets in that _NET_BUFFER_LIST have been processed.

"At this point I dare to speculate the vulnerability may possibly be triggered by specially crafting packets which will cause an incorrect parsing by IppSendError... But what we've seen so far illustrates a very important point. That the vulnerability can't be triggered with a single packet. In fact, you'll have to flood the destination with packets just to reach the vulnerable path."

Read the whole thread with the technical jargon if you can't understand my summary. His take is that 9.8 severity is overblown because "at best we're talking about a remote denial of service and full RCE is intractable in this case."

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-19T02:48:13.469Z ##

Let's do a quick PoC check-in for #CVE_2024_38063, the IPv6 takeover bug in Windows, shall we?

This cute lil friend isn't even source code. Just an executable, which I will be taking apart tonight.

This Python repo, unless I'm misreading it, is utter BS that just does a dramatic reenactment of an exploit.

And this empty repo comes from one of the most vapory GH profiles I've seen in some time.

I'm sure I missed one, and I'm sure y'all will find it. But right now, seems like this thing is still theoretical. Of course patch, but do not panic.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-17T02:13:42.000Z ##

Robel Campbell of Blackpoint Cyber does it again: Regarding CVE-2024-38063 IPV6 RCE in Windows...
I saw this mentioned earlier on Mastodon but didn't get to boost it. Robel was able to create a PoC that causes a crash. His RCA on CVE-2024-38063:

The bug check in this case isn't too detailed, but essentially the underflow creates a large value used in a loop which eventually write data out of bounds and causes a crash.
I imagine this can be weaponized using heap massaging techniques and corrupting adjacent objects in the heap.

h/t: @decio

#CVE_2024_38063 #vulnerability #microsoft #ipv6 #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T20:27:47.000Z ##

So in reading up on CVE-2024-38140 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Reliable Multicast Transport Driver (RMCAST) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, I learned that a team called Microsoft Offensive Research & Security Engineering (MORSE) exists! Someone from MORSE was credited with disclosing it. (I personally would have saved the zero-day for a rainy day.) The only other information we have is from the FAQ:

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending specially crafted packets to a Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) open socket on the server, without any interaction from the user.

This sounds very similar to the IPv6 RCE vulnerability CVE-2024-38063 that got everyone wildin. Except this one's CWE (referring to CVE-2024-38140) is Use After Free (CWE-416).

#CVE_2024_38140 #microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #RMCAST

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-08-16T09:40:03.000Z ##

Windows et Windows Server impactés par une faille de sécurité critique dans IPv6 ! https://www.it-connect.fr/windows-faille-critique-dans-ipv6-cve-2024-38063/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Vulnérabilité #Microsoft

##
malwaretech@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T05:40:22.000Z ##

Has anyone else looked at CVE-2024-38063? I could use a sanity check here. From what I can see, the vulnerable code path can only be triggered with IPv6 Jumbograms (packets larger than 65535 bytes). Not only would the target system need to have Jumbograms enabled, but every link in the path between the attacker and target would have to both support Jumbograms and have them enabled. I can't imagine any real world scenario in which this would occur, so unless I'm missing something, this vulnerability could only be exploited on very few real world systems.

##

CVE-2024-7646
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-16T18:31:08

1 posts

A security issue was discovered in ingress-nginx where an actor with permission to create Ingress objects (in the `networking.k8s.io` or `extensions` API group) can bypass annotation validation to inject arbitrary commands and obtain the credentials of the ingress-nginx controller. In the default configuration, that credential has access to all secrets in the cluster.

1 repos

https://github.com/r0binak/CVE-2024-7646

ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2024-08-17T05:06:25.000Z ##

CVE-2024-7646 #SuggestedRead #devopsish https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/126744

##

CVE-2024-7262
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-16T15:32:48

4 posts

Improper path validation in promecefpluginhost.exe in Kingsoft WPS Office version ranging from 12.2.0.13110 to 12.2.0.13489 on Windows allows an attacker to load an arbitrary Windows library. Using the MHTML format allows an attacker to automatically deliver a malicious library on opening the document and a single user click on a crafted hyperlink leads to the execution of the library.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T14:57:44.725Z ##

ESET Research: Analysis of two arbitrary code execution vulnerabilities affecting WPS Office
No surprise that software vendor Kingsoft does not want to disclose in-the-wild zero-day exploitation of CVE-2024-7672 (9.3 critical, published 15 August 2024 and silently patched by Kingsoft sometime March 2024) WPS Office arbitrary code execution via path traversal (!!! cc: @cR0w @reverseics). It is being exploited by a South Korea-aligned Advanced Persistent Threat, called APT-C-60, to target East Asian countries. The final payload is a custom backdoor dubbed SpyGlace. ESET also discovered CVE-2024-7263 (9.3 critical, same info as previous 7262 CVE), which is an alternate method of hijacking the control flow of the same WPS Office plugin component. IOC provided.

See related The Hacker News reporting: APT-C-60 Group Exploit WPS Office Flaw to Deploy SpyGlace Backdoor

#threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_72762 #CVE_2024_72763 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cyberespionage #southkorea #APTC60 #IOC

CVE-2024-7263
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-16T15:31:41

4 posts

Improper path validation in promecefpluginhost.exe in Kingsoft WPS Office version ranging from 12.2.0.13110 to 12.2.0.13489 on Windows allows an attacker to load an arbitrary Windows library. The patch released in version 12.2.0.16909 to mitigate CVE-2024-7262 was not restrictive enough. Another hyperlink parameter was not properly sanitized which leads to the execution of an arbitrary Windows lib

CVE-2024-29857
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-15T21:38:17

2 posts

An issue was discovered in ECCurve.java and ECCurve.cs in Bouncy Castle Java (BC Java) before 1.78, BC Java LTS before 2.73.6, BC-FJA before 1.0.2.5, and BC C# .Net before 2.3.1. Importing an EC certificate with crafted F2m parameters can lead to excessive CPU consumption during the evaluation of the curve parameters.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

CVE-2024-38193
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-14T16:31:06.880000

16 posts

Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-08-23T18:15:01.000Z ##

🔓 Windows 0-day was exploited by North Korea to install advanced rootkit
— Ars Technica

｢ Microsoft said the vulnerability—in a class known as a "use after free"—was located in AFD.sys, the binary file for what’s known as the ancillary function driver and the kernel entry point for the Winsock API ｣

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/08/windows-0-day-was-exploited-by-north-korea-to-install-advanced-rootkit/

#zeroday #cve #cve202438193 #rootkit #cybersecurity #northkorea

tarnkappeinfo@social.tchncs.de at 2024-08-20T08:06:02.000Z ##

##
jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-08-23T18:15:01.000Z ##

🔓 Windows 0-day was exploited by North Korea to install advanced rootkit
— Ars Technica

｢ Microsoft said the vulnerability—in a class known as a "use after free"—was located in AFD.sys, the binary file for what’s known as the ancillary function driver and the kernel entry point for the Winsock API ｣

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/08/windows-0-day-was-exploited-by-north-korea-to-install-advanced-rootkit/

#zeroday #cve #cve202438193 #rootkit #cybersecurity #northkorea

##
tarnkappeinfo@social.tchncs.de at 2024-08-20T08:06:02.000Z ##

📬 FudModule: Ausgefeiltes Rootkit gräbt sich tief in Windows ein
#Cyberangriffe #ITSicherheit #Avast #CVE202438193 #FudModule #Hacker #Lazarus #WindowsSicherheit https://sc.tarnkappe.info/00e236

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T13:26:57.443Z ##

Gen Digital: Safeguarding Digital Freedom: How a Gen Discovery Helped to Protect Windows Users Everywhere
Reference: CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog same day) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
In June 2024, Gen researchers discovered the North Korean state-sponsored APT Lazarus Group exploiting a hidden security flaw in a crucial part of Windows called the AFD.sys driver. This flaw allowed them to gain unauthorized access to sensitive system areas. They also discovered that they used a special type of malware called Fudmodule to hide their activities from security software.
See related The Hacker News reporting: Microsoft Patches Zero-Day Flaw Exploited by North Korea's Lazarus Group

#CVE_2024_38193 #northkorea #lazarus #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #kev #vulnerability #microsoft #threatintel

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T13:26:57.000Z ##

This flaw allowed them to gain unauthorized access to sensitive system areas. They also discovered that they used a special type of malware called Fudmodule to hide their activities from security software.

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T12:16:49.000Z ##

The security vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-38193 (CVSS score: 7.8), has been described as a privilege escalation bug in the Windows Ancillary Function Driver (AFD.sys) for WinSock. https://thehackernews.com/2024/08/microsoft-patches-zero-day-flaw.html

##

CVE-2024-38213
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.42%

updated 2024-08-14T14:55:49.887000

1 posts

Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T11:59:57.000Z ##

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-38213 and named Copy2Pwn by ZDI, was fixed by Microsoft in June 2024, but it was only disclosed when the tech giant released the August 2024 Patch Tuesday updates. https://www.securityweek.com/copy2pwn-zero-day-exploited-to-bypass-windows-protections/

##

CVE-2024-28986
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.98%

updated 2024-08-14T00:31:10

1 posts

SolarWinds Web Help Desk was found to be susceptible to a Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution vulnerability that, if exploited, would allow an attacker to run commands on the host machine. While it was reported as an unauthenticated vulnerability, SolarWinds has been unable to reproduce it without authentication after thorough testing.   However, out of an abundance of caution, we re

java_discussions@mastodon.social at 2024-08-18T13:21:56.000Z ##

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-28986

##

CVE-2024-38140
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:24

1 posts

Windows Reliable Multicast Transport Driver (RMCAST) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T20:27:47.000Z ##

So in reading up on CVE-2024-38140 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Reliable Multicast Transport Driver (RMCAST) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, I learned that a team called Microsoft Offensive Research & Security Engineering (MORSE) exists! Someone from MORSE was credited with disclosing it. (I personally would have saved the zero-day for a rainy day.) The only other information we have is from the FAQ:

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending specially crafted packets to a Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) open socket on the server, without any interaction from the user.

This sounds very similar to the IPv6 RCE vulnerability CVE-2024-38063 that got everyone wildin. Except this one's CWE (referring to CVE-2024-38140) is Use After Free (CWE-416).

#CVE_2024_38140 #microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #RMCAST

##

CVE-2024-38178
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 2.30%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:21

4 posts

Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.936Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_38208 #CVE_2024_38209 #CVE_2024_38210 #CVE_2024_43477 #CVE_2024_7971 #CVE_2024_38178 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #northkorea #cyberespionage

##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8

  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

##

CVE-2024-7272
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.12%

updated 2024-08-13T15:31:34

4 posts

A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in FFmpeg up to 5.1.5. This affects the function fill_audiodata of the file /libswresample/swresample.c. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. This issue was fixed in version 6.0 by 9903ba28c28ab18dc7b7b6fb8571cc8b5caae1a6 but a backport for 5.1 was forgotten. The exploit ha

yawnbox@disobey.net at 2024-08-22T15:24:13.000Z ##

seems not good for #Mastodon and #Peertube or #Pixelfed? or any #fediverse software that depends on #FFmpeg

https://securityonline.info/cve-2024-7272-critical-heap-overflow-vulnerability-discovered-in-ffmpeg-poc-published/

#mastoadmin

##
neurovagrant@masto.deoan.org at 2024-08-22T12:38:10.000Z ##

CVE-2024-43160
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T12:31:01

2 posts

Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type vulnerability in BerqWP allows Code Injection.This issue affects BerqWP: from n/a through 1.7.6.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.374Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

#CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

##

CVE-2024-42474
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-12T18:35:14

4 posts

### 1. Impacted Products Streamilt Open Source versions before 1.37.0. ### 2. Introduction Snowflake Streamlit open source addressed a security vulnerability via the [static file sharing feature](https://docs.streamlit.io/develop/concepts/configuration/serving-static-files). The vulnerability was patched on Jul 25, 2024, as part of Streamlit open source version 1.37.0. The vulnerability only affe

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T13:56:45.074Z ##

Horizon3: NTLM Credential Theft in Python Windows Applications
NTLMv2 hash theft is possible on Windows hosts through the exploitation of Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF). Horizon3 covers SSRF vulnerabilities leading to NTLMv2 hash disclosure in three of the most popular Python frameworks out there: Gradio by Hugging Face, which powers several popular AI tools; Jupyter Server, which underpins Jupyter Notebook and JupyterLab; and Streamlit from Snowflake.

  • CVE-2024-34510 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Gradio)
  • CVE-2024-35178 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Jupyter Server)
  • CVE-2024-42474 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Streamlit)

The vulnerabilities disclosed here relate to how these Python frameworks retrieve files. Specifically, in Python, any file system operation performed on insufficiently validated input can lead to the leakage of NTLMv2 hashes, and can be exploited by unauthenticated attackers.

#Gradio #Streamlit #Jupyter #vulnerability #CVE_2024_34510 #CVE_2024_35178 #CVE_2024_42474 #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-23T13:56:45.000Z ##

Horizon3: NTLM Credential Theft in Python Windows Applications
NTLMv2 hash theft is possible on Windows hosts through the exploitation of Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF). Horizon3 covers SSRF vulnerabilities leading to NTLMv2 hash disclosure in three of the most popular Python frameworks out there: Gradio by Hugging Face, which powers several popular AI tools; Jupyter Server, which underpins Jupyter Notebook and JupyterLab; and Streamlit from Snowflake.

  • CVE-2024-34510 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Gradio)
  • CVE-2024-35178 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Jupyter Server)
  • CVE-2024-42474 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Streamlit)

The vulnerabilities disclosed here relate to how these Python frameworks retrieve files. Specifically, in Python, any file system operation performed on insufficiently validated input can lead to the leakage of NTLMv2 hashes, and can be exploited by unauthenticated attackers.

#Gradio #Streamlit #Jupyter #vulnerability #CVE_2024_34510 #CVE_2024_35178 #CVE_2024_42474 #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T13:56:45.074Z ##

Horizon3: NTLM Credential Theft in Python Windows Applications
NTLMv2 hash theft is possible on Windows hosts through the exploitation of Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF). Horizon3 covers SSRF vulnerabilities leading to NTLMv2 hash disclosure in three of the most popular Python frameworks out there: Gradio by Hugging Face, which powers several popular AI tools; Jupyter Server, which underpins Jupyter Notebook and JupyterLab; and Streamlit from Snowflake.

  • CVE-2024-34510 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Gradio)
  • CVE-2024-35178 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Jupyter Server)
  • CVE-2024-42474 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Streamlit)

The vulnerabilities disclosed here relate to how these Python frameworks retrieve files. Specifically, in Python, any file system operation performed on insufficiently validated input can lead to the leakage of NTLMv2 hashes, and can be exploited by unauthenticated attackers.

#Gradio #Streamlit #Jupyter #vulnerability #CVE_2024_34510 #CVE_2024_35178 #CVE_2024_42474 #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-23T13:56:45.000Z ##

Horizon3: NTLM Credential Theft in Python Windows Applications
NTLMv2 hash theft is possible on Windows hosts through the exploitation of Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF). Horizon3 covers SSRF vulnerabilities leading to NTLMv2 hash disclosure in three of the most popular Python frameworks out there: Gradio by Hugging Face, which powers several popular AI tools; Jupyter Server, which underpins Jupyter Notebook and JupyterLab; and Streamlit from Snowflake.

  • CVE-2024-34510 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Gradio)
  • CVE-2024-35178 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Jupyter Server)
  • CVE-2024-42474 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Streamlit)

The vulnerabilities disclosed here relate to how these Python frameworks retrieve files. Specifically, in Python, any file system operation performed on insufficiently validated input can lead to the leakage of NTLMv2 hashes, and can be exploited by unauthenticated attackers.

#Gradio #Streamlit #Jupyter #vulnerability #CVE_2024_34510 #CVE_2024_35178 #CVE_2024_42474 #cve

The manipulation of the argument aid leads to improper control of resource identifiers. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T04:12:39.000Z ##

@Sempf if I'm not mistaken, this is CVE-2024-7438 (CVSSv4: 5.3 or CVSSv3 4.3 medium)

A vulnerability has been found in SimpleMachines SMF 2.1.4 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /index.php?action=profile;u=2;area=showalerts;do=read of the component User Alert Read Status Handler. The manipulation of the argument aid leads to improper control of resource identifiers. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

  • CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:N/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N
  • CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N

EDIT: actually might be unrelated. Concerning how many PoCs are floating around for SMF

VMware ESXi contains an authentication bypass vulnerability. A malicious actor with sufficient Active Directory (AD) permissions can gain full access to an ESXi host that was previously configured to use AD for user management https://blogs.vmware.com/vsphere/2012/09/joining-vsphere-hosts-to-active-directory.html by re-creating the configured AD group ('ESXi Admins' by default) after it was dele

threatcodex at 2024-08-28T18:07:03.670Z ##

BlackByte blends tried-and-true tradecraft with newly disclosed vulnerabilities to support ongoing attacks
#BlackByte #CVE_2024_37085
https://blog.talosintelligence.com/blackbyte-blends-tried-and-true-tradecraft-with-newly-disclosed-vulnerabilities-to-support-ongoing-attacks/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T13:45:17.719Z ##

Cisco Talos: BlackByte blends tried-and-true tradecraft with newly disclosed vulnerabilities to support ongoing attacks
Reference: CVE-2024-37085 (7.2 high, disclosed 25 June 2024 by Broadcom, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 30 July 2024) VMware ESXi Authentication Bypass Vulnerability.

BlackByte is a ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) group believed to be an offshoot of the Conti ransomware group. They continue leveraging tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs) such as the use of vulnerable drivers (BYOVD) to bypass security protections. They also exploited CVE-2024-37085 shortly after it was disclosed. Cisco highlights a change in the ransomware encryptor that appends “blackbytent_h” file extension to encrypted files (previously unreported), drops four vulnerable driver files now, and uses victim Active Directory credentials to self-propagate. The BlackByte group is also probably more active than its data leak site may imply (only 20-30% of victims have an extortion post). Cisco has recommendations and IOC.

See related The Hacker News reporting: BlackByte Ransomware Exploits VMware ESXi Flaw in Latest Attack Wave

#threatintel #blackbyte #ransomware #raas #conti #CVE_2024_37085 #eitw #IOC #byovd

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-28T13:45:17.000Z ##

BlackByte is a ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) group believed to be an offshoot of the Conti ransomware group. They continue leveraging tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs) such as the use of vulnerable drivers (BYOVD) to bypass security protections. They also exploited CVE-2024-37085 shortly after it was disclosed. ##

CVE-2024-38206
(8.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-07T00:30:52

2 posts

An authenticated attacker can bypass Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) protection in Microsoft Copilot Studio to leak sensitive information over a network.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T14:38:12.026Z ##

Tenable: SSRFing the Web with the help of Copilot Studio
See parent toot above for the initial security advisory.
Tenable provides a technical analysis of CVE-2024-38206 (Microsoft considers it a 8.5 high, NVD evaluated it as 6.5 medium) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability. They leveraged Copilot's ability to make external web requests in a server-side request forgery (SSRF). Coupled with an SSRF protection bypass, Tenable researchers were able to get access to Microsoft's internal infrastructure for Copilot Studio, including the Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) and internal Cosmos DB instances. This included access to potentially sensitive information regarding service internals with potential cross-tenant impact. They noted that the infrastructure used for this Copilot Studio service was shared among tenants. Any impact on that infrastructure could affect multiple customers.

#CVE_2024_38206 #SSRF #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft #CopilotStudio #copilot

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T14:38:12.000Z ##

See parent toot above for the initial security advisory.
Tenable provides a technical analysis of CVE-2024-38206 (Microsoft considers it a 8.5 high, NVD evaluated it as 6.5 medium) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability. They leveraged Copilot's ability to make external web requests in a server-side request forgery (SSRF). Coupled with an SSRF protection bypass, Tenable researchers were able to get access to Microsoft's internal infrastructure for Copilot Studio, including the Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) and internal Cosmos DB instances. This included access to potentially sensitive information regarding service internals with potential cross-tenant impact. They noted that the infrastructure used for this Copilot Studio service was shared among tenants. Any impact on that infrastructure could affect multiple customers.

CVE-2024-34750
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-04T05:01:04

2 posts

Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions, Uncontrolled Resource Consumption vulnerability in Apache Tomcat. When processing an HTTP/2 stream, Tomcat did not handle some cases of excessive HTTP headers correctly. This led to a miscounting of active HTTP/2 streams which in turn led to the use of an incorrect infinite timeout which allowed connections to remain open which should have been closed.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

CVE-2024-7029
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-02T15:31:27

2 posts

Commands can be injected over the network and executed without authentication.

1 repos

https://github.com/K3ysTr0K3R/CVE-2024-7029-EXPLOIT

screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T18:16:44.206Z ##

Akamai: Beware the Unpatchable: Corona Mirai Botnet Spreads via Zero-Day
Reference: CVE-2024-7029 (CNA: 8.7 high, disclosed 02 August 2024 by CISA) AVTECH IP camera command injection vulnerability. See parent toot above for initial reporting from Security Week.

Akamai finally provides a writeup explaining the situation: a Corona Mirai variant Botnet is leveraging a previously undisclosed zero-day vulnerability now tracked as CVE-2024-7029 to add vulnerable AVTECH IP camera devices to its collection. IOC are provided. They describe the vulnerability (quoted text verbatim, bold emphasis is Akamai's):

The first active campaign we observed began on March 18, 2024, but analysis showed activity for this variant as early as December 2023. The proof of concept (PoC) for CVE-2024-7029 has been publicly available since at least 2019, but it never had a proper CVE assignment until August 2024.

The exploit of this vulnerability allows an attacker to execute remote code on a target system. Here are some bonus CVEs being exploited in the wild for your consideration (to the KEV Catalog):

The botnet also targeted several other vulnerabilities including a Hadoop YARN RCE, CVE-2014-8361, and CVE-2017-17215.

#threatintel #mirai #botnet #vulnerability #zeroday #cve #CVE_2024_7029 #avtech #cisa #rce #poc #corona #hadoop

The first active campaign we observed began on March 18, 2024, but analysis showed activity for this variant as early as December 2023. The proof of concept (PoC) for CVE-2024-7029 has been publicly available since at least 2019, but it never had a proper CVE assignment until August 2024.

CVE-2024-27275
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T21:32:46

2 posts

IBM i 7.2, 7.3, 7.4, and 7.5 contains a local privilege escalation vulnerability caused by an insufficient authority requirement. A local user without administrator privilege can configure a physical file trigger to execute with the privileges of a user socially engineered to access the target file. The correction is to require administrator privilege to configure trigger support. IBM X-Force ID:

silentsignal at 2024-08-27T07:11:55.196Z ##

IBM issued a fix to CVE-2024-27275 that mitigates an #IBMi privilege escalation technique we published last year:

🥷https://blog.silentsignal.eu/2023/03/30/booby-trapping-ibm-i/
🧑‍🏭https://ibm.com/support/pages/node/7157637

The PTF restricts the use of the ADDPFTRG command - this is a breaking change documented in the Memo to Users.

##
silentsignal@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-27T07:11:55.000Z ##

IBM issued a fix to CVE-2024-27275 that mitigates an #IBMi privilege escalation technique we published last year:

🥷https://blog.silentsignal.eu/2023/03/30/booby-trapping-ibm-i/
🧑‍🏭https://ibm.com/support/pages/node/7157637

The PTF restricts the use of the ADDPFTRG command - this is a breaking change documented in the Memo to Users.

##

CVE-2024-6387
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 71.47%

updated 2024-07-30T03:31:55

2 posts

A signal handler race condition was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

96 repos

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T16:12:40.117Z ##

Cisco security advisories for today 21 August 2024:

  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20375 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine REST API Blind SQL Injection Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20417 (6.5 medium) (Note: not fixed, migrate off to a fixed release lolz)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Sensitive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20466 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20486 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20488 (6.1 medium)

Bonus: Cisco updated the vulnerable products list for CVE-2024-6387 Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH Server (aka #regreSSHion)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T16:12:40.000Z ##

Cisco security advisories for today 21 August 2024:

  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20375 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine REST API Blind SQL Injection Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20417 (6.5 medium) (Note: not fixed, migrate off to a fixed release lolz)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Sensitive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20466 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20486 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20488 (6.1 medium)

Bonus: Cisco updated the vulnerable products list for CVE-2024-6387 Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH Server (aka #regreSSHion)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

CVE-2018-0802
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 96.50%

updated 2024-07-25T13:45:59.623000

1 posts

Equation Editor in Microsoft Office 2007, Microsoft Office 2010, Microsoft Office 2013, and Microsoft Office 2016 allow a remote code execution vulnerability due to the way objects are handled in memory, aka "Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE is unique from CVE-2018-0797 and CVE-2018-0812.

7 repos

https://github.com/zldww2011/CVE-2018-0802_POC

https://github.com/Abdibimantara/Maldoc-Analysis

https://github.com/Palvinder-Singh/PS_CVE2018-0802

https://github.com/likescam/CVE-2018-0802_CVE-2017-11882

https://github.com/rxwx/CVE-2018-0802

https://github.com/Ridter/RTF_11882_0802

habr@zhub.link at 2024-08-26T15:32:14.000Z ##

Security Week 2435: долгоживущие уязвимости в продуктах Microsoft

На прошлой неделе специалисты «Лаборатории Касперского» опубликовали отчет об эволюции уязвимостей в ПО за второй квартал 2024 года. Отчет основан на статистике из внешних источников и собственных данных компании. Особый интерес представляет статистика уязвимостей, эксплуатировать которые пытается реальное вредоносное ПО. Судя по этим данным, киберпреступники достаточно активно эксплуатируют несвежие проблемы в популярном программном обеспечении. В частности, пользователи компьютеров под управлением Windows чаще всего сталкиваются с эксплойтами, нацеленными на уязвимости, обнаруженные и закрытые от трех до семи лет назад. Эксплойты под Linux чаще нацелены на более свежие уязвимости в ядре ОС. Совершенно противоположную картину демонстрирует статистика по часто эксплуатируемым уязвимостям в таргетированных атаках, нацеленных на бизнес. В этом случае в TOP 10 уязвимостей представлено куда больше недавно обнаруженных проблем, включая, например, уязвимость в VPN-сервере Ivanti Connect Secure. Помимо общей статистики, авторы отчета также выбрали три наиболее «интересные» уязвимости среди обнаруженных во втором квартале 2024 года.

https://habr.com/ru/companies/kaspersky/articles/838558/

#microsoft #CVE20180802

##

CVE-2019-1003030
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 8.98%

updated 2024-07-16T20:28:14

4 posts

A sandbox bypass vulnerability exists in Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin 2.63 and earlier in pom.xml, src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/workflow/cps/CpsGroovyShell.java that allows attackers able to control pipeline scripts to execute arbitrary code on the Jenkins master JVM.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.260Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T21:47:14.204Z ##

@jerry @kuoirad Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.
  • It's a path traversal vulnerability! a favorite of @reverseics

#CVE_2024_23897 #Jenkins #CISA #KEV #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation

CVE-2024-5535
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-12T15:31:25

2 posts

Issue summary: Calling the OpenSSL API function SSL_select_next_proto with an empty supported client protocols buffer may cause a crash or memory contents to be sent to the peer. Impact summary: A buffer overread can have a range of potential consequences such as unexpected application beahviour or a crash. In particular this issue could result in up to 255 bytes of arbitrary private data from me

screaminggoat at 2024-08-22T18:21:35.893Z ##

Palo Alto Networks security advisory: CVE-2024-5535 Informational Bulletin: Impact of OpenSSL Vulnerability CVE-2024-5535
It's okay to put down your lampshades: Palo Alto Networks products are not affected by CVE-2024-5535 (interestingly CISA-ADP scored 9.1 critical) OpenSSL sensitive information disclosure. "Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue."

@cadey "No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens

#CVE_2024_5535 #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #CVE #OpenSSL

CVE-2024-20399
(6.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.31%

updated 2024-07-10T21:31:40

5 posts

A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root on the underlying operating system of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of arguments that are passed to specific configuration CLI commands. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by including crafted input as the argum

1 repos

https://github.com/Blootus/CVE-2024-20399-Cisco-RCE

breachhq at 2024-08-27T01:40:30.598Z ##

🚨#DataBreach🚨
On July 1, 2024, Cisco released an advisory about a command injection vulnerability in its NX-OS software, identified as CVE-2024-20399. This vulnerability, used by a threat group known as Velvet Ant, allows authenticated users with administrator credentials to execute arbitrary commands at the root level on affected Nexus switches. Sygnia Security discovered and reported this exploit, detailing how Velvet Ant compromised...
https://breach-hq.com/breaches/cisco/2024-aug

##
jbhall56 at 2024-08-23T11:54:15.743Z ##

The activity was observed early this year and involved the weaponization of CVE-2024-20399 (CVSS score: 6.0) to deliver bespoke malware and gain extensive control over the compromised system, facilitating both data exfiltration and persistent access. https://thehackernews.com/2024/08/chinese-hackers-exploit-zero-day-cisco.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-22T16:29:53.680Z ##

Sygnia: China-Nexus Threat Group ‘Velvet Ant’ Leverages a Zero-Day to Deploy Malware on Cisco Nexus Switches
See parent toot above for original Sygnia blog about the Chinese APT Velvet Ant exploiting CVE-2024-20399) as a zero-day. This blog post (I promise it's different) "highlights the technique used by Velvet Ant to compromise Cisco Switch appliances and use them to perform stealthy attacks." Sygnia describes post-exploitation activity and provides an analysis of the VELVETSHELL malware: "it was determined that it is a hybrid customized version of two open-source tools: TinyShell, a Unix backdoor, and 3proxy, a proxy tool...they were identified as being incorporated into a single binary." The only new IOC are file paths.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_20399 #China #cyberespionage #eitw #zeroday #vulnerability #activeexploitation #cisco #linux #nx #VelvetAnt #VelvetShell

##

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-22T16:29:53.000Z ##

Sygnia: China-Nexus Threat Group ‘Velvet Ant’ Leverages a Zero-Day to Deploy Malware on Cisco Nexus Switches
See parent toot above for original Sygnia blog about the Chinese APT Velvet Ant exploiting CVE-2024-20399) as a zero-day. This blog post (I promise it's different) "highlights the technique used by Velvet Ant to compromise Cisco Switch appliances and use them to perform stealthy attacks." Sygnia describes post-exploitation activity and provides an analysis of the VELVETSHELL malware: "it was determined that it is a hybrid customized version of two open-source tools: TinyShell, a Unix backdoor, and 3proxy, a proxy tool...they were identified as being incorporated into a single binary." The only new IOC are file paths.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_20399 #China #cyberespionage #eitw #zeroday #vulnerability #activeexploitation #cisco #linux #nx #VelvetAnt #VelvetShell

##

CVE-2019-1003029
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.77%

updated 2024-07-05T17:55:08

4 posts

A sandbox bypass vulnerability exists in Jenkins Script Security Plugin 1.53 and earlier in src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/scriptsecurity/sandbox/groovy/GroovySandbox.java, src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/scriptsecurity/sandbox/groovy/SecureGroovyScript.java that allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to execute arbitrary code on the Jenkins master JVM.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.260Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.
  • It's a path traversal vulnerability! a favorite of @reverseics

#CVE_2024_23897 #Jenkins #CISA #KEV #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation

updated 2024-07-03T18:32:50

Signal Desktop before 6.2.0 on Windows, Linux, and macOS allows an attacker to obtain potentially sensitive attachments sent in messages from the attachments.noindex directory. Cached attachments are not effectively cleared. In some cases, even after a self-initiated file deletion, an attacker can still recover the file if it was previously replied to in a conversation.
